message.content:
I'll calculate the required financial metrics step by step based on the three financial statements provided.

## Step 1: Calculate Free Cash Flow (FCF)
FCF = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities - Capital Expenditures
FCF = -4,398,760.38 - 324,677.57 = -4,723,437.95

## Step 2: Calculate Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = Net Profit / Total Assets × 100%
ROA = -1,401,436.89 / 14,089,860.66 × 100% = -9.95%

## Step 3: Calculate Return on Equity (ROE)
ROE = Net Profit / Total Owner's Equity × 100%
ROE = -1,401,436.89 / 11,598,563.11 × 100% = -12.08%

## Step 4: Calculate Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio
Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities / Net Profit
Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio = -4,398,760.38 / -1,401,436.89 = 3.14

## Step 5: Calculate Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = Net Profit / Total Revenue × 100%
Net Profit Margin = -1,401,436.89 / 7,825,951.24 × 100% = -17.91%

## Step 6: Calculate Gross Profit Margin
Gross Profit Margin = Gross Profit / Total Revenue × 100%
Gross Profit Margin = 1,535,951.24 / 7,825,951.24 × 100% = 19.63%

```json
{"solution": {'Free Cash Flow (FCF)': '-4723437.95', 'Return on Assets (ROA)': '-9.95%', 'Return on Equity (ROE)': '-12.08%', 'Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio': '3.14', 'Net Profit Margin': '-17.91%', 'Gross Profit Margin': '19.63%'} }
```
